question: Who stated that, "It is better to be a Socrates dissatisfied than a fool satisfied"?
explanation: According to J.S. Mill, Utilitarianism not only included quantity but also quality of pleasure and pain as he asserted that, “It is better to be a Socrates dissatisfied than a fool satisfied”. He asserted that action is moral which increases pleasure and diminishes pain and this pleasure need to be counted in terms of both ; quantity as well as quality.
